intro: Bolax angulata, commonly known as the angular bolax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has distinctive angular leaves that give it its common name. Bolax angulata produces small white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. It is often found in open woodlands and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
